definitions.definition: break or cause to break suddenly and completely, typically with a sharp cracking sound.
emit a sudden, sharp cracking sound.
(of an animal) make a sudden audible bite.
examples: a dog was snapping at his heels
synonyms: bite; gnash its teeth "a dog was snapping at his heels"

definitions.definition: cause to move or alter in a specified way with a brisk movement and typically a sharp sound.

examples: she claims she snapped after years of violence
synonyms: fly off the handle "she snapped after years of violence"

definitions.definition: say something quickly and irritably to someone.
synonyms: retaliate; informaljump down someone's throat "“Be quiet!” Anna snapped"

examples: he planned to spend the time snapping rare wildlife

definitions.definition: put (the ball) into play by a quick backward movement from the ground.

examples: he pulled a white rubber swim hat over his head and snapped it under his chin

definitions.definition: a sudden, sharp cracking sound or movement.
examples: she closed her purse with a snap
synonyms: pop "she closed her purse with a snap"

definitions.definition: a hurried, irritable tone or manner.
examples: “I'm still waiting,” he said with a snap

definitions.definition: vigor or liveliness of style or action; zest.
a small fastener on clothing, engaged by pressing its two halves together.

examples: a control panel that makes operation a snap
synonyms: an easy task; Moreinformala piece of cake
duck soup "it's a snap to put together"

definitions.definition: a quick backward movement of the ball from the ground that begins a play.

examples: photograph, picture, photo, shot, snapshot, print, slide, frame, still; mug shot vacation snaps

definitions.definition: a card game in which cards from two piles are turned over simultaneously and players call “snap” as quickly as possible when two similar cards are exposed.
done or taken on the spur of the moment, unexpectedly, or without notice.
